sen.j: 進藤 貞治（しんどう さだはる、明応6年（1497年） － 天文 (元号)20年（1551年））は日本の戦国時代_(日本)の武将で、近江の六角氏の重臣。
sen.e: Sadaharu SHINDO (1497 – 1551) was a military commander during Japan's Sengoku period (Warring State period) and was chief vassal of the Rokkaku clan.
Sadaharu SHINDO (1497 – 1551) was a military commander during Japan's Sengoku period (Warring State period) and was chief vassal of the Rokkaku clan.

sen.j: 父は進藤長久で、子は進藤賢盛とされる（異説もあり）。
sen.e: His father was Nagahisa SHINDO and child was Katamori SHINDO (opinions differ).
His father was Nagahisa SHINDO and child was Katamori SHINDO (opinions differ).

sen.j: 木浜城主であり、後藤氏とともに「六角氏の両藤」と呼ばれて重用された。
sen.e: He was lord of Konohama Castle and together with the Goto Clan were called the "Rokkaku Clan Dual Wisterias" and deemed important.

As lord of Konohama Castle and one of the "The Two Fuji of the Rokkaku Clans", the other half being the Goto Clan (the kanji for "do" and "to" in "Shindo" and "Goto" are the same, and may be read as "fuji", meaning wisteria) he was an important man.
sen.cmt: “Rokkaku Clan Dual Wisterias” is confusing. Further explanation is required.

sen.j: 貞治は六角高頼・六角定頼の時代に仕えた。
sen.e: Shindo served in the era of Takayori ROKKAKU and Sadayori ROKKAKU.

sen.j: 外交手腕に優れ、時の将軍・足利義晴と細川晴元の和睦を仲介したりなど、多くの功績を立てたと言われている。
sen.e: Having excellent diplomatic skills, it is said he brokered peace between the shoguns of the day; Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and Harumoto HOSOKAWA as well as performing a great number of meritorious deeds.
Sadaharu had excellent diplomatic skills and, among other successes, is said to have brokered peace between the shoguns of the day, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and Harumoto HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: なお、蒲生賢秀や平井定武らとともに、「六角の六家老」と称されることもある。
sen.e: Furthermore, together with Katahide GAMO, Sadatake HIRAI and others were called the "Rokkaku Councilors".
He is sometimes referred to as a "Rokkaku Councilor" along with Katahide GAMO, Sadatake HIRAI and other.
